skillTree.localised_description: Much like the Tinker-in-Chief who commissioned its creation, this grotesque mutant has had many a body part replaced or augmented. Including the addition of a shelf so Morskittar can ride it.
Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
Warp-energy is pulsing - through his veins a charge is racing. On a scale of one to ten, this one's operating on eleven!
Treachery is always a risk; advancing others' careers can quickly become a fatal mistake. However, having accomplished students in your team can outweigh the dangers.
Regarded as the greatest Warlock Engineer every to arise from Skavendom, Lord Morskittar knows a thing or two about making machines work better
Why fire one rocket at the enemy, when you can fire many?
Finding assembly lines inefficient and therefore unsatisfactory, Ikit organises his Skaven workforce to manufacture his designs faster and better than the competition.

effects.description:
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Doomflayer and Doomwheel units
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +2 for Doomflayer and Doomwheel units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When the end finally comes, this one will be there, cackling like the supremely mad scientist he is.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

skillTree.localised_description: As Lord of Clan Skryre and one of the Lords of Decay, Morskittar holds the sanctity of his person utmost. And makes sure all the other Skaven know that as well
When Lord Morskittar opens his personal vaults, there's always enough ammunition. Praise the Horned Rat and pass the musket balls!

effects.description:
Ammunition: +8% for infantry, Warpfire Thrower, Ratling Gun, Warplock Jezzails, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for infantry, Warpfire Thrower, Ratling Gun, Warplock Jezzails, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for infantry, Warpfire Thrower, Ratling Gun, Warplock Jezzails, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Morskittar has deployed his personal touch on his weapon, making it last longer and be far more damaging than it was before. Zzap Zzap!
After many years in dealing with the vagaries of Skaven warp-technology, Lord Morskittar has learned how to direct warp energy away from himself in a safe manner. For a Skaven, anyway
Refining technology used on lesser creatures, Lord Morskittar wards away any who would dare approach

ui_effects.localised_text: Enemies hit by vortex in melee combat

skillTree.localised_description: "Power surge now, exploding through, yes-yes-yes-YES!!!!!!"
Be wary of one who can renergise himself in the middle of the battle, lest the tide be turned!

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Unlimited power corrupts the already-totally-corrupted utterly.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

skillTree.localised_description: Having to hide, for an extended period, in a dark, dank recess, in order to entrap and kill your target encourages lateral thinking.

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

skillTree.localised_description: This one has seen the hideous deformities created by Clan Moulder firsthand and now fancies himself a dab hand with a needle and thread

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

skillTree.localised_description: Early years spent in the gutter both prepares the ambitious rat for power and schools him in the dirtier, more cut-throat ways of war.

	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Gutter Runners and Night Runners units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows just what to say to 'encourage' the very best work from his underling Warp-smiths and technicians.

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

Armour: +10 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere  even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle  spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Lord Morskittar, Emperor of Warlocks and Tinker-in-Chief, is the current ruler of Clan Skryre and a member of the Council of Thirteen. Even though he is considered the greatest Warlock-Engineer to have ever lived, very little is known about the Emperor of Warlocks, save perhaps that he extremely ancient, having been kept alive for long years by vats of life-giving fluids.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -50% for Warpfire Thrower, Warp Lightning Cannon and Doomwheel units
	(all units in army)
